me.utk.util.misc

Class Verifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.utk.util.misc.Verifier

  • public abstract class Verifier
extends Object
    An abstract utility class for verification functions.

    This class provides these methods:

    • The verify method, which throws a specified exception if and only if the given boolean expression evaluates to false.
    • The match methods, which throw specified exceptions if and only if the two given arguments are not equivalent to each other, either by == for primitives or by the equals method for Objects.
    Version:
    December 1, 2020
    Author:
    Utkarsh Priyam

    • Method Detail

      • verify

        public static void verify(boolean bool,
                          Class<? extends RuntimeException> clazz,
                          Supplier<String> message)
        Verifies that the given boolean bool is true, and throws the specified exception with the given reason otherwise.

        Calling this method is equivalent to calling Verifier.match(bool, true, clazz, message).

        Parameters:
        bool - The boolean to verify as true
        clazz - The class of the exception to throw
        message - The reason for throwing the exception

      • match

        public static void match(Object obj1,
                         Object obj2,
                         Class<? extends RuntimeException> clazz,
                         Supplier<String> message)
        Verifies that the given Objects obj1 and obj2 are equal using the equals method, and throws the specified exception with the given reason otherwise.

        Calling this method is equivalent to running: 

         if (!Objects.equals(obj1, obj2))
     throw // exception of type clazz and message message
        Parameters:
        obj1 - The first Object in the equality check
        obj2 - The second Object in the equality check
        clazz - The class of the exception to throw
        message - The reason for throwing the exception

      • match

        public static void match(long arg1,
                         long arg2,
                         Class<? extends RuntimeException> clazz,
                         Supplier<String> message)
        Verifies that the given longs arg1 and arg2 are equal using ==, and throws the specified exception with the given reason otherwise.

        Calling this method is equivalent to running: 

         if (arg1 != arg2)
     throw // exception of type clazz and message message
        Parameters:
        arg1 - The first long in the equality check
        arg2 - The second long in the equality check
        clazz - The class of the exception to throw
        message - The reason for throwing the exception
